00036 Image::Image ( ) : set( "sequenceNumber,rowVec,columnVec,sliceVec,coilChannelMask,DICOM/EchoNumbers" ), clean( false )
00037 {
00038     addNeededFromString( neededProperties );
00039     set.addSecondarySort( "acquisitionNumber" );
00040     set.addSecondarySort( "acquisitionTime" );
00041 }
00042 
00043 Image::Image ( const Chunk &chunk, dimensions min_dim ) :
00044     _internal::NDimensional<4>(), util::PropertyMap(), minIndexingDim( min_dim ),
00045     set( "sequenceNumber,rowVec,columnVec,coilChannelMask,DICOM/EchoNumbers" ),
00046     clean( false )
00047 {
00048     addNeededFromString( neededProperties );
00049     set.addSecondarySort( "acquisitionNumber" );
00050     set.addSecondarySort( "acquisitionTime" );
00051 
00052     if ( ! ( insertChunk( chunk ) && reIndex() && isClean() ) ) {
00053         LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Failed to create image from single chunk.";
00054     } else if( !isValid() ) {
00055         LOG_IF( !getMissing().empty(), Debug, warning )
00056                 << "The created image is missing some properties: " << getMissing() << ". It will be invalid.";
00057     }
00058 }
00059 
00060 Image::Image( const isis::data::Image &ref ): _internal::NDimensional<4>(), util::PropertyMap(),
00061     set( "" )/*SortedChunkList has no default constructor - lets just make an empty (and invalid) set*/
00062 {
00063     ( *this ) = ref; // set will be replaced here anyway
00064 }
00065 
00066 Image &Image::operator=( const isis::data::Image &ref )
00067 {
00068     //deep copy bases
00069     static_cast<util::PropertyMap &>( *this ) = static_cast<const util::PropertyMap &>( ref );
00070     static_cast<_internal::NDimensional< 4 >&>( *this ) = static_cast<const _internal::NDimensional< 4 >&>( ref );
00071     //deep copy members
00072     chunkVolume = ref.chunkVolume;
00073     clean = ref.clean;
00074     set = ref.set;
00075     minIndexingDim = ref.minIndexingDim;
00076     //replace all chunks (in set) by cheap copies of them
00077     struct : public _internal::SortedChunkList::chunkPtrOperator {
00078         boost::shared_ptr< Chunk > operator()( const boost::shared_ptr< Chunk >& ptr ) {
00079             return boost::shared_ptr< Chunk > ( new Chunk( *ptr ) );
00080         }
00081     } replace;
00082     set.transform( replace );
00083     lookup = set.getLookup();
00084     return *this;
00085 }

00088 bool Image::checkMakeClean()
00089 {
00090     if ( ! clean ) {
00091         LOG( Debug, info )  << "Image is not clean. Running reIndex ...";
00092 
00093         if( !reIndex() ) {
00094             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Reindexing failed -- undefined behavior ahead ...";
00095         }
00096     }
00097 
00098     return clean;
00099 }
00100 bool Image::isClean()const
00101 {
00102     return clean;
00103 }
00104 
00105 void Image::deduplicateProperties()
00106 {
00107     LOG_IF( lookup.empty(), Debug, error ) << "The lookup table is empty. Won't do anything.";
00108     const boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &first = lookup[0];
00109     //@todo might fail if the image contains a prop that differs to that in the Chunks (which is equal in the chunks)
00110     util::PropertyMap common;
00111     util::PropertyMap::KeyList uniques;
00112     first->toCommonUnique( common, uniques, true );
00113 
00114     for ( size_t i = 1; i < lookup.size(); i++ ) {
00115         lookup[i]->toCommonUnique( common, uniques, false );
00116     }
00117 
00118     LOG( Debug, info ) << uniques.size() << " Chunk-unique properties found in the Image";
00119     LOG_IF( uniques.size(), Debug, verbose_info ) << util::listToString( uniques.begin(), uniques.end(), ", " );
00120 
00121     // list should not be unified - they belong into their chunk even if they are common
00122     common.remove( common.findLists() );
00123 
00124     join( common );
00125     LOG_IF( ! common.isEmpty(), Debug, verbose_info ) << "common properties saved into the image " << common;
00126 
00127     //remove common props from the chunks
00128     for ( size_t i = 0; i != lookup.size(); i++ )
00129         lookup[i]->remove( common, false ); //this _won't keep needed properties - so from here on the chunks of the image are invalid
00130 
00131     LOG_IF( ! common.isEmpty(), Debug, verbose_info ) << "common properties removed from " << lookup.size() << " chunks: " << common;
00132 
00133 }
00134 
00135 bool Image::insertChunk ( const Chunk &chunk )
00136 {
00137     if ( chunk.getVolume() == 0 ) {
00138         LOG( Runtime, error )
00139                 << "Cannot insert empty Chunk (Size is " << chunk.getSizeAsString() << ").";
00140         return false;
00141     }
00142 
00143     if ( ! chunk.isValid() ) {
00144         LOG( Runtime, error )
00145                 << "Cannot insert invalid chunk. Missing properties: " << chunk.getMissing();
00146         return false;
00147     }
00148 
00149     if( clean ) {
00150         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Resetting image structure because of new insertion.";
00151         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Inserting into already indexed images is inefficient. You should not do that.";
00152 
00153         // re-gather all properties of the chunks from the image
00154         BOOST_FOREACH( boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ref, lookup ) {
00155             ref->join( *this );
00156         }
00157     }
00158 
00159 
00160     LOG_IF( chunk.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" )[3] != 0, Debug, warning )
00161             << " inserting chunk with nonzero at the 4th position - you shouldn't use the fourth dim for the time (use acquisitionTime)";
00162 
00163     if( set.insert( chunk ) ) { // if the insertion was successful the image has to be reindexed anyway
00164         clean = false;
00165         lookup.clear();
00166         return true;
00167     } else {
00168         // if the insertion failed but the image was clean - de-duplicate properties again
00169         // the image is still clean - no need reindex
00170         if( clean )
00171             deduplicateProperties();
00172 
00173         return false;
00174     }
00175 }
00176 
00177 void Image::setIndexingDim( dimensions d )
00178 {
00179     minIndexingDim = d;
00180 
00181     if( clean ) {
00182         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Image was allready indexed. reIndexing ...";
00183         reIndex();
00184     }
00185 }
00186 
00187 util::fvector4 Image::getPhysicalCoordsFromIndex( const isis::util::ivector4 &voxelCoords ) const
00188 {
00189     return  util::fvector4( voxelCoords[0] * m_RowVec[0] + voxelCoords[1] * m_ColumnVec[0] + voxelCoords[2] * m_SliceVec[0],
00190                             voxelCoords[0] * m_RowVec[1] + voxelCoords[1] * m_ColumnVec[1] + voxelCoords[2] * m_SliceVec[1],
00191                             voxelCoords[0] * m_RowVec[2] + voxelCoords[1] * m_ColumnVec[2] + voxelCoords[2] * m_SliceVec[2],
00192                             voxelCoords[3] )
00193             + m_Offset ;
00194 }

00197 
00198 
00199 util::ivector4 Image::getIndexFromPhysicalCoords( const isis::util::fvector4 &physicalCoords, bool restrictedToImageBox ) const
00200 {
00201     util::fvector4 vec1 = physicalCoords - m_Offset;
00202     util::fvector4 ret = util::fvector4( vec1[0] * m_RowVecInv[0] + vec1[1] * m_ColumnVecInv[0] + vec1[2] * m_SliceVecInv[0],
00203                                          vec1[0] * m_RowVecInv[1] + vec1[1] * m_ColumnVecInv[1] + vec1[2] * m_SliceVecInv[1],
00204                                          vec1[0] * m_RowVecInv[2] + vec1[1] * m_ColumnVecInv[2] + vec1[2] * m_SliceVecInv[2],
00205                                          vec1[3] );
00206 
00207     util::ivector4 retAsIvector4 = util::Value<util::fvector4>( ret ).as<util::ivector4>();
00208 
00209     if( restrictedToImageBox ) {
00210         const util::vector4<size_t> size = getSizeAsVector();
00211 
00212         for( unsigned short i = 0; i < 4; i ++ ) {
00213             if( retAsIvector4[i] < 0 )retAsIvector4[i] =  0;
00214 
00215             if( retAsIvector4[i] >= static_cast<int>( size[i] ) )retAsIvector4[i] =  static_cast<int>( size[i] - 1 );
00216         }
00217     }
00218 
00219     return  retAsIvector4;
00220 }
00221 
00222 
00223 bool Image::updateOrientationMatrices()
00224 {
00225     const util::fvector4 rowVec = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "rowVec" );
00226     const util::fvector4 columnVec = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "columnVec" );
00227     const util::fvector4 sliceVec = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "sliceVec" );
00228     m_Offset = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00229     util::fvector4 spacing = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelSize" ) + ( hasProperty( "voxelGap" ) ? getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelGap" ) : util::fvector4( 0, 0, 0 ) );
00230 
00231     for( unsigned short i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00232         if( spacing[i] == 0 ) spacing[i] = 1;
00233     }
00234 
00235     m_RowVec = util::fvector4( rowVec[0] * spacing[0], rowVec[1] * spacing[0], rowVec[2] * spacing[0] );
00236     m_ColumnVec = util::fvector4( columnVec[0] * spacing[1], columnVec[1] * spacing[1], columnVec[2] * spacing[1] );
00237     m_SliceVec = util::fvector4( sliceVec[0] * spacing[2], sliceVec[1] * spacing[2], sliceVec[2] * spacing[2] );
00238     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Created orientation matrix: ";
00239     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "[ " << m_RowVec[0] << " " << m_ColumnVec[0] << " " << m_SliceVec[0] << " ] + " << m_Offset[0];
00240     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "[ " << m_RowVec[1] << " " << m_ColumnVec[1] << " " << m_SliceVec[1] << " ] + " << m_Offset[1];
00241     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "[ " << m_RowVec[2] << " " << m_ColumnVec[2] << " " << m_SliceVec[2] << " ] + " << m_Offset[2];
00242 
00243     //since we do not want to calculate the inverse matrix with every getVoxelCoords call again we do it here once
00244     for ( size_t i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00245         spacing[i] = spacing[i] ? 1.0 / spacing[i] : 0;
00246     }
00247 
00248     //for inversion of the orientation we use boost::ublas
00249     using namespace boost::numeric::ublas;
00250     matrix<float> orientation = matrix<float>( 3, 3 );
00251     matrix<float> inverse = matrix<float>( 3, 3 );
00252 
00253     for( size_t i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00254         orientation( i, 0 ) = m_RowVec[i];
00255         orientation( i, 1 ) = m_ColumnVec[i];
00256         orientation( i, 2 ) = m_SliceVec[i];
00257     }
00258 
00259     if( !_internal::inverseMatrix<float>( orientation, inverse ) ) {
00260         LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Could not create the inverse of the orientation matrix!";
00261         return false;
00262     };
00263 
00264     for( size_t i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00265         m_RowVecInv[i] = inverse( i, 0 );
00266         m_ColumnVecInv[i] = inverse( i, 1 );
00267         m_SliceVecInv[i] = inverse( i, 2 );
00268     }
00269 
00270     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Created transposed orientation matrix: ";
00271     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "[ " << m_RowVecInv[0] << " " << m_ColumnVecInv[0] << " " << m_SliceVecInv[0] << " ] + " << m_Offset[0];
00272     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "[ " << m_RowVecInv[1] << " " << m_ColumnVecInv[1] << " " << m_SliceVecInv[1] << " ] + " << m_Offset[1];
00273     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "[ " << m_RowVecInv[2] << " " << m_ColumnVecInv[2] << " " << m_SliceVecInv[2] << " ] + " << m_Offset[2];
00274     return true;
00275 }
00276 
00277 bool Image::transformCoords( boost::numeric::ublas::matrix< float > transform_matrix, bool transformCenterIsImageCenter )
00278 {
00279     //for transforming we have to ensure to have the below properties in our chunks and image
00280     std::list<std::string > neededProps;
00281     neededProps.push_back ( "indexOrigin" );
00282     neededProps.push_back ( "rowVec" );
00283     neededProps.push_back ( "columnVec" );
00284     neededProps.push_back ( "sliceVec" );
00285     neededProps.push_back ( "voxelSize" );
00286     //propagate needed properties to chunks
00287     BOOST_FOREACH ( std::vector<boost::shared_ptr< data::Chunk> >::reference chRef, lookup ) {
00288         BOOST_FOREACH ( std::list<std::string>::reference props, neededProps ) {
00289             if ( hasProperty ( props.c_str() ) && !chRef->hasProperty ( props.c_str() ) ) {
00290                 chRef->setPropertyAs<util::fvector4> ( props.c_str(), getPropertyAs<util::fvector4> ( props.c_str() ) );
00291             }
00292         }
00293 
00294         if ( !chRef->transformCoords ( transform_matrix, transformCenterIsImageCenter ) ) {
00295             return false;
00296         }
00297     }
00298     //      establish initial state
00299 
00300     if ( !isis::data::_internal::transformCoords ( *this, getSizeAsVector(), transform_matrix, transformCenterIsImageCenter ) ) {
00301         LOG ( Runtime, error ) << "Error during transforming the coords of the image.";
00302         return false;
00303     }
00304 
00305     if ( !updateOrientationMatrices() ) {
00306         LOG ( Runtime, error ) << "Could not update the orientation matrices of the image!";
00307         return false;
00308     }
00309 
00310     deduplicateProperties();
00311     return true;
00312 }
00313 
00314 dimensions Image::mapScannerAxisToImageDimension( scannerAxis scannerAxes )
00315 {
00316     updateOrientationMatrices();
00317     boost::numeric::ublas::matrix<float> latchedOrientation = boost::numeric::ublas::zero_matrix<float>( 4, 4 );
00318     boost::numeric::ublas::vector<float>mapping( 4 );
00319     latchedOrientation( m_RowVec.getBiggestVecElemAbs(), 0 ) = 1;
00320     latchedOrientation( m_ColumnVec.getBiggestVecElemAbs(), 1 ) = 1;
00321     latchedOrientation( m_SliceVec.getBiggestVecElemAbs(), 2 ) = 1;
00322     latchedOrientation( 3, 3 ) = 1;
00323 
00324     for( size_t i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
00325         mapping( i ) = i;
00326     }
00327 
00328     return static_cast<dimensions>( boost::numeric::ublas::prod( latchedOrientation, mapping )( scannerAxes ) );
00329 
00330 }
00331 
00332 
00333 bool Image::reIndex()
00334 {
00335     if ( set.isEmpty() ) {
00336         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Reindexing an empty image is useless.";
00337         return false;
00338     }
00339 
00340     if( !set.isRectangular() ) {
00341         LOG( Runtime, error ) << "The image is incomplete. Aborting reindex. (horizontal size is " << set.getHorizontalSize() << ")";
00342         return false;
00343     }
00344 
00345     //redo lookup table
00346     lookup = set.getLookup();
00347     util::FixedVector<size_t, dims> structure_size; //storage for the size of the chunk structure
00348     structure_size.fill( 1 );
00349     //get primary attributes from geometrically first chunk - will be usefull
00350     const Chunk &first = chunkAt( 0 );
00351     //start indexing at eigther the chunk-size or the givem minIndexingDim (whichever is bigger)
00352     const unsigned short chunk_dims = std::max<unsigned short>( first.getRelevantDims(), minIndexingDim );
00353     chunkVolume = first.getVolume();
00355     // Determine structure of the image by searching for dimensional breaks in the chunklist
00357     //get indexOrigin from the geometrically first chunk
00358     propertyValue( "indexOrigin" ) = first.propertyValue( "indexOrigin" );
00359     //if there are many chunks, they must leave at least on dimension to the image to "sort" them in
00360     const size_t timesteps = set.getHorizontalSize();
00361     const unsigned short sortDims = dims - ( timesteps > 1 ? 1 : 0 ); // dont use the uppermost dim, if the timesteps are already there
00362 
00363     if ( chunk_dims >= Image::dims ) {
00364         if ( lookup.size() > 1 ) {
00365             LOG( Runtime, error )
00366                     << "Cannot handle multiple Chunks, if they have more than "
00367                     << Image::dims - 1 << " dimensions";
00368             return false;
00369         }
00370 
00371         //if there is only one chunk, its ok - the image will consist only of this one,
00372         //and commonGet will allways return <0,set.begin()->getLinearIndex()>
00373         //thus in this case voxel() equals set.begin()->voxel()
00374     } else {// OK there is at least one dimension to sort in the chunks
00375         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Computing strides for dimensions " << util::MSubject( chunk_dims + 1 ) << " to " << util::MSubject( sortDims );
00376 
00377         // check the chunks for at least one dimensional break - use that for the size of that dimension
00378         for ( unsigned short i = chunk_dims; i < sortDims; i++ ) { //if there are dimensions left figure out their size
00379             structure_size[i] = getChunkStride( structure_size.product() ) / structure_size.product();
00380             assert( structure_size[i] != 0 );
00381         }
00382     }
00383 
00384     if ( sortDims < dims ) { //if there is a timedim (not all dims was used for geometric sort)
00385         assert( structure_size[sortDims] == 1 );
00386         structure_size[sortDims] = timesteps; // fill the dim above the top geometric dim with the timesteps
00387     }
00388 
00389     assert( structure_size.product() == lookup.size() );
00390     //Clean up the properties
00391     deduplicateProperties();
00392 
00393     // add the chunk-size to the image-size
00394     for ( unsigned short i = 0; i < chunk_dims; i++ )
00395         structure_size[i] = first.getDimSize( i );
00396 
00397     init( structure_size ); // set size of the image
00399     //reconstruct some redundant information, if its missing
00401     const util::PropertyMap::KeyType vectors[] = {"rowVec", "columnVec", "sliceVec"};
00402     int oneCnt = 0;
00403     BOOST_FOREACH( const util::PropertyMap::KeyType & ref, vectors ) {
00404         if ( hasProperty( ref ) ) {
00405             util::PropertyValue &prop = propertyValue( ref );
00406             LOG_IF( !prop.is<util::fvector4>(), Debug, error ) << "Using " << prop.getTypeName() << " as " << util::Value<util::fvector4>::staticName();
00407             util::fvector4 &vec = prop.castTo<util::fvector4>();
00408 
00409             if( vec.sqlen() == 0 ) {
00410                 util::fvector4  v_one;
00411                 v_one[oneCnt] = 1;
00412                 LOG( Runtime, error )
00413                         << "The existing " << ref << " " << vec << ( hasProperty( "source" ) ? " from " + getPropertyAs<std::string>( "source" ) : "" ) << " has the length zero. Falling back to " << v_one << ".";
00414                 vec = v_one;
00415             }
00416 
00417             vec.norm();
00418         }
00419 
00420         oneCnt++;
00421     }
00422 
00423     util::fvector4 &voxeSize = propertyValue( "voxelSize" ).castTo<util::fvector4>();
00424 
00425     for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
00426         if( std::isinf( voxeSize[i] ) ) {
00427             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "voxelSize[" << i << "] is invalid, using 1";
00428             voxeSize[i] = 1;
00429         }
00430     }
00431 
00432 
00433     //if we have at least two slides (and have slides (with different positions) at all)
00434     if ( chunk_dims == 2 && structure_size[2] > 1 && first.hasProperty( "indexOrigin" ) ) {
00435         const util::fvector4 thisV = first.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00436         const Chunk &last = chunkAt( structure_size[2] - 1 );
00437 
00438         if ( last.hasProperty( "indexOrigin" ) ) {
00439             const util::fvector4 lastV = last.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00440             //check the slice vector
00441             util::fvector4 distVecNorm = lastV - thisV;
00442             LOG_IF( distVecNorm.len() == 0, Runtime, error )
00443                     << "The distance between the the first and the last chunk is zero. Thats bad, because I'm going to normalize it.";
00444             distVecNorm.norm();
00445 
00446             if ( hasProperty( "sliceVec" ) ) {
00447                 const util::fvector4 sliceVec = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "sliceVec" );
00448                 LOG_IF( ! distVecNorm.fuzzyEqual( sliceVec ), Runtime, info )
00449                         << "The existing sliceVec " << sliceVec
00450                         << " differs from the distance vector between chunk 0 and " << structure_size[2] - 1
00451                         << " " << distVecNorm;
00452             } else {
00453                 LOG( Debug, info )
00454                         << "used the distance between chunk 0 and " << structure_size[2] - 1
00455                         << " to synthesize the missing sliceVec as " << distVecNorm;
00456                 propertyValue( "sliceVec" ) = distVecNorm;
00457             }
00458         }
00459 
00460         const Chunk &next = chunkAt( 1 );
00461 
00462         if ( next.hasProperty( "indexOrigin" ) ) {
00463             const util::fvector4 nextV = next.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00464             const float sliceDist = ( nextV - thisV ).len() - voxeSize[2];
00465 
00466             if ( sliceDist > 0 ) {
00467                 const float inf = std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00468 
00469                 if ( ! hasProperty( "voxelGap" ) ) { // @todo check this
00470                     setPropertyAs( "voxelGap", util::fvector4( 0, 0, inf, 0 ) );
00471                 }
00472 
00473                 util::fvector4 &voxelGap = propertyValue( "voxelGap" ).castTo<util::fvector4>(); //if there is no voxelGap yet, we create it
00474 
00475                 if ( voxelGap[2] != inf ) {
00476                     if ( ! util::fuzzyEqual( voxelGap[2], sliceDist ) ) {
00477                         LOG_IF( ! util::fuzzyEqual( voxelGap[2], sliceDist ), Runtime, warning )
00478                                 << "The existing slice distance (voxelGap[2]) " << util::MSubject( voxelGap[2] )
00479                                 << " differs from the distance between chunk 0 and 1, which is " << sliceDist;
00480                     }
00481                 } else {
00482                     voxelGap[2] = sliceDist;
00483                     LOG( Debug, info )
00484                             << "used the distance between chunk 0 and 1 to synthesize the missing slice distance (voxelGap[2]) as "
00485                             << sliceDist;
00486                 }
00487             }
00488         }
00489     }
00490 
00491     //if we have row- and column- vector
00492     if ( hasProperty( "rowVec" ) && hasProperty( "columnVec" ) ) {
00493         util::fvector4 &row = propertyValue( "rowVec" ).castTo<util::fvector4>();
00494         util::fvector4 &column = propertyValue( "columnVec" ).castTo<util::fvector4>();
00495         LOG_IF( row.dot( column ) > 0.01, Runtime, warning ) << "The cosine between the columns and the rows of the image is bigger than 0.01";
00496         const util::fvector4 crossVec = util::fvector4( //we could use their cross-product as sliceVector
00497                                             row[1] * column[2] - row[2] * column[1],
00498                                             row[2] * column[0] - row[0] * column[2],
00499                                             row[0] * column[1] - row[1] * column[0]
00500                                         );
00501 
00502         if ( hasProperty( "sliceVec" ) ) {
00503             util::fvector4 &sliceVec = propertyValue( "sliceVec" ).castTo<util::fvector4>(); //get the slice vector
00504             LOG_IF( std::acos( crossVec.dot( sliceVec ) )  > 180 / M_PI, Runtime, warning ) //angle more than one degree
00505                     << "The existing sliceVec " << sliceVec
00506                     << " differs from the cross product of the row- and column vector " << crossVec;
00507         } else {
00508             // We dont know anything about the slice-direction
00509             // we just guess its along the positive cross-product between row- and column direction
00510             // so at least warn the user if we do that long shot
00511             LOG( Runtime, info )
00512                     << "used the cross product between rowVec and columnVec as sliceVec:"
00513                     << crossVec << ". That might be wrong!";
00514             setPropertyAs( "sliceVec", crossVec );
00515         }
00516     }
00517 
00518     if ( hasProperty( "fov" ) ) {
00519         util::fvector4 &propFoV = propertyValue( "fov" ).castTo<util::fvector4>();
00520 
00521         const util::fvector4 &calcFoV = getFoV();
00522 
00523         bool ok = true;
00524 
00525         for ( size_t i = 0; i < dims; i++ ) {
00526             if ( propFoV[i] != -std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity() ) {
00527                 ok &= util::fuzzyEqual( propFoV[i], calcFoV[i] );
00528             } else
00529                 propFoV[i] = calcFoV[i];
00530         }
00531 
00532         LOG_IF( ! ok, Runtime, info )
00533                 << "The calculated field of view differs from the stored " << propFoV << "/" << calcFoV;
00534     }
00535 
00536     LOG_IF( ! isValid(), Runtime, warning ) << "The image is not valid after reindexing. Missing properties: " << getMissing();
00537 
00538     // check if there is a list in any chunk
00539     bool found = false;
00540 
00541     for ( size_t i = 0; i < lookup.size() && found == false; i++ ) {
00542         const KeyList lists_list = lookup[i]->findLists();
00543         LOG_IF( !lists_list.empty(), Debug, info ) << "Found property-lists " << util::MSubject( lists_list ) << " in chunk number " << i << " going to splice the image";
00544         found = !lists_list.empty();
00545     }
00546 
00547     if( found ) { // splice down the image one step if there are some
00548         const size_t relDims = lookup[0]->getRelevantDims();
00549         assert( relDims > 1 );
00550         spliceDownTo( static_cast<data::dimensions>( relDims - 1 ) );
00551     }
00552 
00553 
00554     updateOrientationMatrices();
00555     return clean = isValid();
00556 }
00557 bool Image::isEmpty()const
00558 {
00559     return set.isEmpty();
00560 }
00561 
00562 const boost::shared_ptr< Chunk >& Image::chunkPtrAt( size_t pos )const
00563 {
00564     LOG_IF( lookup.empty(), Debug, error ) << "The lookup table is empty. Run reIndex first.";
00565     LOG_IF( pos >= lookup.size(), Debug, error ) << "Index is out of the range of the lookup table (" << pos << ">=" << lookup.size() << ").";
00566     const boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ptr = lookup[pos];
00567     LOG_IF( !ptr, Debug, error ) << "There is no chunk at " << pos << ". This usually happens in incomplete images.";
00568     return ptr;
00569 }
00570 
00571 Chunk Image::getChunkAt( size_t pos, bool copy_metadata )const
00572 {
00573     Chunk ret( *chunkPtrAt( pos ) );
00574 
00575     if( copy_metadata )ret.join( *this ); // copy all metadata from the image in here
00576 
00577     return ret;
00578 }
00579 Chunk &Image::chunkAt( size_t pos )
00580 {
00581     return *chunkPtrAt( pos );
00582 }
00583 
00584 Chunk Image::getChunk ( size_t first, size_t second, size_t third, size_t fourth, bool copy_metadata )
00585 {
00586     checkMakeClean();
00587     return const_cast<const Image &>( *this ).getChunk( first, second, third, fourth, copy_metadata ); // use the const version
00588 }
00589 
00590 const Chunk Image::getChunk ( size_t first, size_t second, size_t third, size_t fourth, bool copy_metadata ) const
00591 {
00592     const size_t index = commonGet( first, second, third, fourth ).first;
00593     return getChunkAt( index, copy_metadata );
00594 }
00595 
00596 void Image::copyToValueArray( ValueArrayBase &dst, scaling_pair scaling ) const
00597 {
00598     if( getVolume() > dst.getLength() ) {
00599         LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Image wont fit into the ValueArray, wont copy..";
00600         return;
00601     }
00602 
00603     if ( clean ) {
00604         if ( scaling.first.isEmpty() || scaling.second.isEmpty() ) {
00605             scaling = getScalingTo ( dst.getTypeID() );
00606         }
00607 
00608         std::vector< ValueArrayReference > targets;
00609 
00610         if( lookup.size() > 1 ) { //if there are more than 1 chunks
00611             //splice target to have the same parts as the image
00612             targets = dst.splice( lookup.front()->getVolume() );
00613         } else {
00614             //just put that ValueArray into the list
00615             targets.push_back( dst );
00616         }
00617 
00618         std::vector< ValueArrayReference >::iterator target = targets.begin();
00619         BOOST_FOREACH ( const boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ref, lookup ) { // copy chunks into the parts
00620             if ( !ref->getValueArrayBase().copyTo ( **target, scaling ) ) {
00621                 LOG ( Runtime, error )
00622                         << "Failed to copy raw data of type " << ref->getTypeName() << " from " << getSizeAsString() << "-image into ValueArray of type "
00623                         << dst.getTypeName() << " and length " << dst.getLength();
00624             }
00625 
00626             target++;
00627         }
00628     } else {
00629         LOG ( Runtime, error ) << "Cannot copy from non clean images. Run reIndex first";
00630     }
00631 }
00632 
00633 std::vector< Chunk > Image::copyChunksToVector( bool copy_metadata )const
00634 {
00635     std::vector<isis::data::Chunk> ret;
00636     ret.reserve( lookup.size() );
00637     std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> >::const_iterator at = lookup.begin();
00638     const std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> >::const_iterator end = lookup.end();
00639 
00640     while ( at != end ) {
00641         ret.push_back( **( at++ ) );
00642 
00643         if( copy_metadata )
00644             ret.back().join( *this );
00645     }
00646 
00647     return ret;
00648 }
00649 
00650 size_t Image::getChunkStride ( size_t base_stride )
00651 {
00652     LOG_IF( set.isEmpty(), Runtime, error ) << "Trying to get chunk stride in an empty image";
00653     LOG_IF( lookup.empty(), Debug, error ) << "Lookup table for chunks is empty. Do reIndex() first!";
00654 
00655     if ( lookup.size() >= 4 * base_stride ) {
00656         /* there can't be any stride with less than 3*base_stride chunks (which would actually be an invalid image)
00657          * _____
00658          * |c c| has no stride/dimensional break
00659          * _____
00660          * |c c|
00661          * |c  | has a dimensional break, but is invalid
00662          * _____
00663          * |c c|
00664          * |c c| is the first reasonable case
00665          */
00666         // get the distance between first and second chunk for comparision
00667         const util::fvector4 firstV = chunkAt( 0 ).getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00668         const util::fvector4 secondV = chunkAt( base_stride ).getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00669         const util::fvector4 dist1 = secondV - firstV;
00670 
00671         if( dist1.sqlen() == 0 ) { //if there is no geometric structure anymore - so asume its flat from here on
00672             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Distance between 0 and " << util::MSubject( base_stride )
00673                                << " is zero. Assuming there are no dimensional breaks anymore. Returning " << util::MSubject( base_stride );
00674             return base_stride;
00675         } else for ( size_t i = base_stride; i < lookup.size() - base_stride; i += base_stride ) {  // compare every follwing distance to that
00676                 const util::fvector4 thisV = chunkAt( i ).getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00677                 const util::fvector4 nextV = chunkAt( i + base_stride ).getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00678                 const util::fvector4 distFirst = nextV - firstV;
00679                 const util::fvector4 distThis = nextV - thisV;
00680                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info )
00681                         << "Distance between chunk " << util::MSubject( i ) << " and " << util::MSubject( i + base_stride )
00682                         << " is " << distThis.len() << ". Distance between 0 and " << util::MSubject( i + base_stride ) << " is " << distFirst.len();
00683 
00684                 if ( distFirst.sqlen() <= distThis.sqlen() ) { // the next chunk is nearer to the begin than to this => dimensional break => leave
00685                     LOG( Debug, info )
00686                             << "Distance between chunk " << util::MSubject( i + base_stride )
00687                             << " and 0 is not bigger than the distance between " << util::MSubject( i + base_stride )
00688                             << " and " << util::MSubject( i ) << ", assuming dimensional break at " << i + base_stride;
00689                     return i + base_stride;
00690                 }
00691             }
00692     } else  if ( lookup.size() % base_stride ) {
00693         LOG( Runtime, error )
00694                 << "The amount of chunks (" << lookup.size()
00695                 << ") is not divisible by the block size of the dimension below (" << base_stride
00696                 << "). Maybe the image is incomplete.";
00697         LOG( Runtime, warning )
00698                 << "Ignoring "  <<  lookup.size() % base_stride << " chunks.";
00699         return lookup.size() - ( lookup.size() % base_stride );
00700     }
00701 
00702     //we didn't find any break, so we assume its a linear image |c c ... c|
00703     LOG( Debug, info )
00704             << "No dimensional break found, assuming it to be at the end (" << lookup.size() << "/" << set.getHorizontalSize() << ")";
00705     return lookup.size() / set.getHorizontalSize();
00706 }
00707 
00708 std::list<util::PropertyValue> Image::getChunksProperties( const util::PropertyMap::KeyType &key, bool unique )const
00709 {
00710     std::list<util::PropertyValue > ret;
00711 
00712     if( clean ) {
00713         BOOST_FOREACH( const boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ref, lookup ) {
00714             const util::PropertyValue &prop = ref->propertyValue( key );
00715 
00716             if ( unique && prop.isEmpty() ) //if unique is requested and the property is empty
00717                 continue; //skip it
00718             else if ( unique && !ret.empty() &&  prop == ret.back() )
00719                 //if unique is requested and the property is equal to the one added before
00720                 continue;//skip it
00721             else
00722                 ret.push_back( prop );
00723         }
00724     } else {
00725         LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Cannot get chunk-properties from non clean images. Run reIndex first";
00726     }
00727 
00728     return ret;
00729 }
00730 
00731 size_t Image::getMaxBytesPerVoxel() const
00732 {
00733     size_t bytes = chunkPtrAt( 0 )->getBytesPerVoxel();
00734     BOOST_FOREACH( const boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ref, lookup ) {
00735         LOG_IF( bytes != ref->getBytesPerVoxel(), Debug, warning )
00736                 << "Not all voxels have the same byte size (" << bytes << "!=" << ref->getBytesPerVoxel() << "). Using the biggest.";
00737 
00738         if( bytes < ref->getBytesPerVoxel() ) {
00739             bytes = ref->getBytesPerVoxel();
00740         }
00741     }
00742     return bytes;
00743 }
00744 
00745 std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> Image::getMinMax () const
00746 {
00747     std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> ret;
00748 
00749     if( !lookup.empty() ) {
00750         std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> >::const_iterator i = lookup.begin();
00751         ret = ( *i )->getMinMax();
00752 
00753         for( ++i; i != lookup.end(); ++i ) {
00754             std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> current = ( *i )->getMinMax();
00755 
00756             if( ret.first->gt( *current.first ) )
00757                 ret.first = current.first;
00758 
00759             if( ret.second->lt( *current.second ) )
00760                 ret.second = current.second;
00761         }
00762     }
00763 
00764     return ret;
00765 }
00766 
00767 // @todo this wont work with images of more 2 two different data types
00768 std::pair< util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference > Image::getScalingTo( short unsigned int targetID, autoscaleOption scaleopt ) const
00769 {
00770     LOG_IF( !clean, Debug, error ) << "You should run reIndex before running this";
00771     std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> minmax = getMinMax();
00772 
00773     BOOST_FOREACH( const boost::shared_ptr<const Chunk> &ref, lookup ) { //find a chunk which would be converted
00774         if( targetID != ref->getTypeID() ) {
00775             const scaling_pair scale = ref->getScalingTo( targetID, minmax, scaleopt );
00776             LOG_IF( scale.first.isEmpty() || scale.second.isEmpty(), Debug, error ) << "Returning an invalid scaling. This is bad!";
00777             return scale; // and ask that for the scaling
00778         }
00779     }
00780     return std::make_pair( //ok seems like no conversion is needed - return 1/0
00781                util::ValueReference( util::Value<uint8_t>( 1 ) ),
00782                util::ValueReference( util::Value<uint8_t>( 0 ) )
00783            );
00784 }
00785 
00786 size_t Image::compare( const isis::data::Image &comp ) const
00787 {
00788     size_t ret = 0;
00789     LOG_IF( ! ( clean && comp.clean ), Debug, error )
00790             << "Comparing unindexed images will cause you trouble, run reIndex()!";
00791 
00792     if ( getSizeAsVector() != comp.getSizeAsVector() ) {
00793         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Size of images differs (" << getSizeAsVector() << "/"
00794                                 << comp.getSizeAsVector() << "). Adding difference to the result.";
00795         ret += ( getSizeAsVector() - comp.getSizeAsVector() ).product();
00796     }
00797 
00798     util::ivector4 compVect( util::minVector( chunkPtrAt( 0 )->getSizeAsVector(), comp.chunkPtrAt( 0 )->getSizeAsVector() ) );
00799     util::ivector4 start;
00800     const size_t increment = compVect.product();
00801 
00802     for ( size_t i = 0; i < getVolume(); i += increment ) {
00803         const size_t nexti = i + increment - 1;
00804         const std::pair<size_t, size_t> c1pair1( i / chunkVolume, i % chunkVolume );
00805         const std::pair<size_t, size_t> c1pair2( nexti / chunkVolume, nexti % chunkVolume );
00806         const std::pair<size_t, size_t> c2pair1( i / comp.chunkVolume, i % comp.chunkVolume );
00807         assert( c1pair1.first == c1pair2.first );
00808         LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Comparing chunks at " << c1pair1.first << " and "   << c2pair1.first;
00809         const Chunk &c1 = *chunkPtrAt( c1pair1.first );
00810         const Chunk &c2 = *( comp.chunkPtrAt( c2pair1.first ) );
00811         LOG( Debug, verbose_info )
00812                 << "Start positions are " << c1pair1.second << " and " << c2pair1.second
00813                 << " and the length is " << c1pair2.second - c1pair1.second;
00814         ret += c1.getValueArrayBase().compare( c1pair1.second, c1pair2.second, c2.getValueArrayBase(), c2pair1.second );
00815     }
00816 
00817     return ret;
00818 }
00819 
00820 Image::orientation Image::getMainOrientation()const
00821 {
00822     LOG_IF( ! isValid() || ! clean, Debug, warning ) << "You should not run this on non clean image. Run reIndex first.";
00823     util::fvector4 row = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "rowVec" );
00824     util::fvector4 column = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "columnVec" );
00825     row.norm();
00826     column.norm();
00827     LOG_IF( row.dot( column ) > 0.01, Runtime, warning ) << "The cosine between the columns and the rows of the image is bigger than 0.01";
00828     const util::fvector4 crossVec = util::fvector4(
00829                                         row[1] * column[2] - row[2] * column[1],
00830                                         row[2] * column[0] - row[0] * column[2],
00831                                         row[0] * column[1] - row[1] * column[0]
00832                                     );
00833     const util::fvector4 x( 1, 0 ), y( 0, 1 ), z( 0, 0, 1 );
00834     double a_axial    = std::acos( crossVec.dot( z ) ) / M_PI;
00835     double a_sagittal = std::acos( crossVec.dot( x ) ) / M_PI;
00836     double a_coronal  = std::acos( crossVec.dot( y ) ) / M_PI;
00837     bool a_inverse = false, s_inverse = false, c_inverse = false;
00838     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Angles to vectors are " << ( a_sagittal * 180 ) << " to x, " << ( a_coronal * 180 ) << " to y and " << ( a_axial * 180 ) << " to z";
00839 
00840     if( a_axial > .5 ) {
00841         a_axial = std::abs( a_axial - 1 );
00842         a_inverse = true;
00843     }
00844 
00845     if( a_sagittal > .5 ) {
00846         a_sagittal = std::abs( a_sagittal - 1 );
00847         s_inverse = true;
00848     }
00849 
00850     if( a_coronal > .5 ) {
00851         a_coronal = std::abs( a_coronal - 1 );
00852         c_inverse = true;
00853     }
00854 
00855     if( a_axial <= .25 )
00856         return a_inverse ? reversed_axial : axial;
00857     else if( a_sagittal <= .25 )
00858         return s_inverse ? reversed_sagittal : sagittal;
00859     else if( a_coronal <= .25 )
00860         return c_inverse ? reversed_coronal : coronal;
00861     else
00862         assert( false );
00863 
00864     return axial; //will never be reached
00865 }
00866 
00867 unsigned short Image::getMajorTypeID() const
00868 {
00869     switch( getChunk( 0 ).getTypeID() ) { // dont do smart typeID detection for types who cant do minmax
00870     case data::ValueArray<util::color24>::staticID:
00871     case data::ValueArray<util::color48>::staticID:
00872     case data::ValueArray<std::complex< float >  >::staticID:
00873     case data::ValueArray<std::complex< double > >::staticID:
00874         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Using flat typeID for " << getChunk( 0 ).getTypeName() << " because I cannot compute min/max";
00875         return getChunk( 0 ).getTypeID();
00876         break;
00877     default:
00878         std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> minmax = getMinMax();
00879         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Determining  datatype of image with the value range " << minmax;
00880 
00881         if( minmax.first->getTypeID() == minmax.second->getTypeID() ) { // ok min and max are the same type - trivial case
00882             return minmax.first->getTypeID() << 8; // btw: we do the shift, because min and max are Value - but we want the ID's ValueArray
00883         } else if( minmax.first->fitsInto( minmax.second->getTypeID() ) ) { // if min fits into the type of max, use that
00884             return minmax.second->getTypeID() << 8; //@todo maybe use a global static function here instead of a obscure shit operation
00885         } else if( minmax.second->fitsInto( minmax.first->getTypeID() ) ) { // if max fits into the type of min, use that
00886             return minmax.first->getTypeID() << 8;
00887         } else {
00888             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Sorry I dont know which datatype I should use. (" << minmax.first->getTypeName() << " or " << minmax.second->getTypeName() << ")";
00889             std::stringstream o;
00890             o << "Type selection failed. Range was: " << minmax;
00891             throw( std::logic_error( o.str() ) );
00892         }
00893 
00894         break;
00895     }
00896 
00897     return 0; // id 0 is invalid
00898 }
00899 std::string Image::getMajorTypeName() const
00900 {
00901     return util::getTypeMap()[getMajorTypeID()];
00902 }
00903 
00904 bool Image::convertToType( short unsigned int ID, autoscaleOption scaleopt )
00905 {
00906     bool retVal = true;
00907     BOOST_FOREACH( boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ref, lookup ) {
00908         retVal &= ( ref->getTypeID() == ID );
00909     }
00910 
00911     if( retVal ) // if all chunks allready have the requested type we can skip the rest
00912         return true;
00913 
00914     // get value range of the image for the conversion
00915     scaling_pair scale = getScalingTo( ID, scaleopt );
00916 
00917     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Computed scaling of the original image data: [" << scale << "]";
00918     retVal = true;
00919     //we want all chunks to be of type ID - so tell them
00920     BOOST_FOREACH( boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ref, lookup ) {
00921         retVal &= ref->convertToType( ID, scale );
00922     }
00923     return retVal;
00924 }
00925 
00926 size_t Image::spliceDownTo( dimensions dim ) //rowDim = 0, columnDim, sliceDim, timeDim
00927 {
00928     if( lookup[0]->getRelevantDims() < ( size_t ) dim ) {
00929         LOG( Debug, error ) << "The dimensionality of the chunks of this image is already below " << dim << " cannot splice it.";
00930         return 0;
00931     } else if( lookup[0]->getRelevantDims() == ( size_t ) dim ) {
00932         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Skipping useless splicing, relevantDims is already " << lookup[0]->getRelevantDims();
00933         return lookup.size();
00934     }
00935 
00936     util::vector4<size_t> image_size = getSizeAsVector();
00937 
00938     for( int i = 0; i < dim; i++ )
00939         image_size[i] = 1;
00940 
00941     // get a list of needed properties (everything which is missing in a newly created chunk plus everything which is needed for autosplice)
00942     const std::list<util::PropertyMap::KeyType> splice_needed = util::stringToList<util::PropertyMap::KeyType>( util::PropertyMap::KeyType( "voxelSize,voxelGap,rowVec,columnVec,sliceVec,indexOrigin,acquisitionNumber" ), ',' );
00943     util::PropertyMap::KeyList needed = MemChunk<short>( 1 ).getMissing();
00944     needed.insert( splice_needed.begin(), splice_needed.end() );
00945     struct splicer {
00946         dimensions m_dim;
00947         Image &m_image;
00948         size_t m_amount;
00949         splicer( dimensions dimemsion, size_t amount, Image &image ): m_dim( dimemsion ), m_image( image ), m_amount( amount ) {}
00950         void operator()( const Chunk &ch ) {
00951             const size_t topDim = ch.getRelevantDims() - 1;
00952 
00953             if( topDim >= ( size_t ) m_dim ) { // ok we still have to splice that
00954                 const size_t subSize = m_image.getSizeAsVector()[topDim];
00955                 assert( !( m_amount % subSize ) ); // there must not be any "remaining"
00956                 splicer sub( m_dim, m_amount / subSize, m_image );
00957                 BOOST_FOREACH( const Chunk & ref, ch.autoSplice( uint32_t( m_amount / subSize ) ) ) {
00958                     sub( ref );
00959                 }
00960             } else { // seems like we're done - insert it into the image
00961                 assert( ch.getRelevantDims() == ( size_t ) m_dim ); // index of the higest dim>1 (ch.getRelevantDims()-1) shall be equal to the dim below the requested splicing (m_dim-1)
00962                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Inserting splice result of size " << ch.getSizeAsVector() << " at " << ch.propertyValue( "indexOrigin" );
00963                 m_image.insertChunk( ch );
00964             }
00965         }
00966     };
00967     std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> > buffer = lookup; // store the old lookup table
00968     lookup.clear();
00969     set.clear(); // clear the image, so we can insert the splices
00970     clean = false; // mark the image for reIndexing
00971     //static_cast<util::PropertyMap::base_type*>(this)->clear(); we can keep the common properties - they will be merged with thier own copies from the chunks on the next reIndex
00972     splicer splice( dim, image_size.product(), *this );
00973     BOOST_FOREACH( boost::shared_ptr<Chunk> &ref, buffer ) {
00974         BOOST_FOREACH( const util::PropertyMap::KeyType & need, needed ) { //get back properties needed for the
00975             if( !ref->hasProperty( need ) && this->hasProperty( need ) ) {
00976                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Copying " << need << "=" << this->propertyValue( need ) << " from the image to the chunk for splicing";
00977                 ref->propertyValue( need ) = this->propertyValue( need );
00978             }
00979         }
00980         splice( *ref );
00981     }
00982     reIndex();
00983     return lookup.size();
00984 }
00985 
00986 size_t Image::foreachChunk( ChunkOp &op, bool copyMetaData )
00987 {
00988     size_t err = 0;
00989     checkMakeClean();
00990     util::vector4<size_t> imgSize = getSizeAsVector();
00991     util::vector4<size_t> chunkSize = getChunk( 0, 0, 0, 0 ).getSizeAsVector();
00992     util::vector4<size_t> pos;
00993 
00994     for( pos[timeDim] = 0; pos[timeDim] < imgSize[timeDim]; pos[timeDim] += chunkSize[timeDim] ) {
00995         for( pos[sliceDim] = 0; pos[sliceDim] < imgSize[sliceDim]; pos[sliceDim] += chunkSize[sliceDim] ) {
00996             for( pos[columnDim] = 0; pos[columnDim] < imgSize[columnDim]; pos[columnDim] += chunkSize[columnDim] ) {
00997                 for( pos[rowDim] = 0; pos[rowDim] < imgSize[rowDim]; pos[rowDim] += chunkSize[rowDim] ) {
00998                     Chunk ch = getChunk( pos[rowDim], pos[columnDim], pos[sliceDim], pos[timeDim], copyMetaData );
00999 
01000                     if( op( ch, pos ) == false )
01001                         err++;
01002                 }
01003             }
01004         }
01005     }
01006 
01007     return err;
01008 }
01009 
01010 size_t Image::getNrOfColumns() const
01011 {
01012     return getDimSize( data::rowDim );
01013 }
01014 
01015 size_t Image::getNrOfRows() const
01016 {
01017     return getDimSize( data::columnDim );
01018 }
01019 size_t Image::getNrOfSlices() const
01020 {
01021     return getDimSize( data::sliceDim );
01022 }
01023 size_t Image::getNrOfTimesteps() const
01024 {
01025     return getDimSize( data::timeDim );
01026 }
01027 
01028 util::fvector4 Image::getFoV() const
01029 {
01030     util::fvector4 voxelGap;
01031 
01032     if ( hasProperty( "voxelGap" ) ) {
01033         voxelGap = getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelGap" );
01034 
01035         for ( size_t i = 0; i < dims; i++ )
01036             if ( voxelGap[i] == -std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity() ) {
01037                 LOG( Runtime, info ) << "Ignoring unknown voxel gap in direction " << i;
01038                 voxelGap[i] = 0;
01039             }
01040     }
01041 
01042     return _internal::NDimensional<4>::getFoV( getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelSize" ), voxelGap );
01043 }
01044 
01045 Image::iterator Image::begin()
01046 {
01047     if( checkMakeClean() ) {
01048         std::vector<Chunk *> vec( lookup.size() );
01049 
01050         for( size_t i = 0; i < lookup.size(); i++ )
01051             vec[i] = lookup[i].get();
01052 
01053         return iterator( vec );
01054     } else {
01055         LOG( Debug, error )  << "Image is not clean. Returning empty iterator ...";
01056         return iterator();
01057     }
01058 }
01059 Image::iterator Image::end() {return begin() + getVolume();}
01060 Image::const_iterator Image::begin()const
01061 {
01062     if( isClean() ) {
01063         std::vector<const Chunk *> vec( lookup.size() );
01064 
01065         for( size_t i = 0; i < lookup.size(); i++ )
01066             vec[i] = lookup[i].get();
01067 
01068         return const_iterator( vec );
01069     } else {
01070         LOG( Debug, error )  << "Image is not clean. Returning empty iterator ...";
01071         return const_iterator();
01072     }
01073 }
01074 Image::const_iterator Image::end()const {return begin() + getVolume();}
01075 
01076 const util::ValueReference Image::getVoxelValue ( size_t nrOfColumns, size_t nrOfRows, size_t nrOfSlices, size_t nrOfTimesteps ) const
01077 {
01078     const size_t idx[] = {nrOfColumns, nrOfRows, nrOfSlices, nrOfTimesteps};
01079     LOG_IF( !isInRange( idx ), Debug, isis::error )
01080             << "Index " << util::vector4<size_t>( idx ) << " is out of range (" << getSizeAsString() << ")";
01081     return begin()[getLinearIndex( idx )];
01082 }
01083 void Image::setVoxelValue ( const util::ValueReference &val, size_t nrOfColumns, size_t nrOfRows, size_t nrOfSlices, size_t nrOfTimesteps )
01084 {
01085     const size_t idx[] = {nrOfColumns, nrOfRows, nrOfSlices, nrOfTimesteps};
01086     LOG_IF( !isInRange( idx ), Debug, isis::error )
01087             << "Index " << util::vector4<size_t>( idx ) << " is out of range (" << getSizeAsString() << ")";
01088     begin()[getLinearIndex( idx )] = val;
01089 }
01090 
01091 std::string Image::identify ( bool withpath )const
01092 {
01093     return
01094         "\"S"
01095         + getPropertyAs<std::string>( "sequenceNumber" )
01096         + ( hasProperty( "sequenceDescription" ) ?
01097             ( "_" + getPropertyAs<std::string>( "sequenceDescription" ) ) :
01098             ""
01099           ) + "\""
01100         + ( withpath ?
01101             ( std::string( " from " ) + getCommonSource( *this ).file_string() ) :
01102             "" )
01103         + ( hasProperty( "sequenceStart" ) ?
01104             ( " taken at " + getPropertyAs<std::string>( "sequenceStart" ) ) :
01105             ""
01106           );
01107 }
